sentences: Tuli tänaval vastu, aga ei teinud meid nägema(gi).
Kui sa oleksid seda näeksid, sa saaksid aru.
Ma peaksin tegema nii, nagu ei näeks kelleki.
translation: to act as if not seeing
context: The word 'näeks' is the conditional form of the verb 'näema' (to see). In this context with the negative prefix 'ei-', it means 'would not see' or 'pretends not to see'. The construction 'nagu ei näeks' specifically means 'as if not seeing' - acting deliberately as if one doesn't see something, often implying intentional ignorance or pretending not to notice.
